title: `EXC_BAD_ACCESS` confused with Stack Overflow...?
body:
Hello, 

This is my first bug report... I hope I can be clear on my error. There was not much more information I can provide here. I am happy to follow up with more specific information, but I guess I'd need some help understanding what to provide.

# The issue

I have a [function in a library which](https://github.com/simPLE-BuildingSimulation/simple_main)—when called—failed, receiving the following error message (this has not been published yet):

```
thread 'some_fun' has overflowed its stack
fatal runtime error: stack overflow
```

However, when I debugged (in VSCode in macOS), it stopped at a specific function (not in the body, but on its declaration?) saying `EXC_BAD_ACCESS`.  This error is located on [another library](https://github.com/SIMPLE-BuildingSimulation/rendering/blob/b5efe1f7674d098f58e28fb2724c465b6e67724c/src/triangle.rs#L191).

I am NOT using unsafe code, although I AM using `portable_simd`

# Expected behaviour

I guess the actual error might be related to the experimental nature of `portable_simd`... but I am not sure why they are reported differently when debugging and running.
